channel.title: Give playername X isDonor points

item.title: Give playername X isDonor points
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

whackatre:

I suggest using split(), which splits up the string into portions (an array), so you can use something similar to the following syntax: ::givedp-player-amount.

Again, I just like half assed it I’m tired and can’t sleep because of insomnia.
I just threw who knows what together and hoped it worked.

item.title: Give playername X isDonor points
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Name is pretty basic. Want to make a command that gives a player X amount of donor points.

if(playerCommand.startsWith("givedp")) { try{ int dpamount = Integer.parseInt(dpAmount[1]); c.sendMessage("You give"+c2.playerName+ dpamount+"donor points"); c2.sendMessage("You recieved"+dpamout+"donor points from"+c.playerName+"."); c2.isDonator =+ dpamount(); c2.logout(); break; }catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } }

Is what I got right now and is wrong since dpamount isn’t declared anywhere.
Honestly, I feel I fucked this command all up since I just sort of half-assed it…

Read full topic
